descriptions.content:
Compounds using two nouns are structured noun (modifier) + noun (modified):

  • གནམ་གྲུ་ “Airplane” (sky-vessel)
  • ལྷ་ཁང་ “Temple” (god-house)
  • དུས་དེབ་ “Journal” (time-book)
  • ཁང་བདག་ “Owner” (house-owner)
  • སྙིང་རུས་ “Endurance” (heart-bone)
  • མིག་ལྤགས་ “Eyelid” (eye-skin)
  • མེ་མདའ་ “Gun” (fire-arrow)
  • མེ་རོ་ “Embers” (fire-corpse)
  • ཆུ་མིག་ “Spring” (water-eye)
  • མིག་ཆུ་ “Tear” (eye-water)

Note: The spelling of a lexical morpheme remains the same whatever its position may be within a word, whether as the first or as the second syllable. There are, however, some rare exceptions to this rule. Thus the word for “skin,” or “bark” is spelled པགས་པ་ when it features as the first syllable, as in པགས་ཞྭ་ “fur hat,” whereas it is written as ལྤགས་ when it occurs as the second syllable, as in ལུག་ལྤགས་ “sheepskin” or ལྟག་ལྤགས་ “tiger-skin.”

Adjective/noun compounds are structured adjective (modifier) + noun (modified):

  • དམ་ཚིག་ “Samaya,” “vow” (sacred-word)
  • ཉེ་ལམ་ “Shortcut” (near-road)
  • དབེན་གནས་ “Hermitage” (lonely-place)

Adjective/verb compounds are structured adjective (modifier) + verb (modified):

  • གསར་བརྗེ་ “Revolution” (new-change)
  • གསར་འཛུགས་ “Construction” (new-establish)
  • ཁོང་འཕེལ་ “Development” (high-increase)
  • ཡར་རྒྱས་ “Progress,” “improvement” (upward-spread)

Verb/noun compounds are structured verb (modifier) + noun (modified):

  • འགྲོ་ལམ་ “Path” (go-way)
  • སློབ་དེབ་ “Manual” (learn-book)
  • ཚོང་དཔོན་ “Merchant” (sell-lord)
  • ལྡོད་ཁང་ “Dwelling” (live-house)
  • སྲུང་སྐར་ “Satellite” (protect-star)

Finally, noun/verb compounds are structured noun (modifier) + verb (modified):

  • བདག་འཛིན་ “Selfishness” (self-hold)
  • སྐྱོན་བརྗོད་ “Criticism” (fault-say)
  • གདན་འདྲེན་ “Invitation” (carpet-draw)
  • སེམས་གསོ་ “Consolation” (mind-repair)
  • རྐུབ་བཀྱག་ “Chair” (backside-lift)
  • ཆུ་ཁོལ་ “Boiled water” (water-boil)
  • རྫས་འགྱུར་ “Chemistry” (object-transform)
  • སྐད་བསྒྱུར་ “Interpreter” (language-transform)
